content: Hey! I'm kicking off this thread to discuss the design changes for the stream dropdown currently being tested here (#25446). While the technical changes were important to fix a bug, we also ended up bundling in design changes based on #25116 (implementation to be verified by Vlad Korobov ). Do folks have any feedback?

I'm not sure I like the filter box being greyed out when you navigate away from it with the keyboard. I think it makes it looks disabled, whereas in fact you can just go back to it (with the mouse or keyboard) to add input.
(@Vlad Korobov @Aman (amanagr) making sure you see this thread.)
Please report any bugs/glitches as well.
The PR link makes this fairly clear, but just for convenience, the way you test this change is to go to the compose box and click on the little v-like thing in the stream dropdown.
image.png
It looks good to me (day mode).

Alya Abbott said:

I'm not sure I like the filter box being greyed out when you navigate away from it with the keyboard. I think it makes it looks disabled, whereas in fact you can just go back to it (with the mouse or keyboard) to add input.

It actually feels natural to me.

I guess my only quibble is that the gray effect for the input not being focused looks too similar to the gray for the current item being selected, especially when you are on the first item:

image.png
I would expect the styling for the current element being focused in the dropdown to be bolder and brighter.

For example, even in Zulip itself, you can see the more standard way to select the current item in a dropdown. Open the gear menu and traverse down through the items. The currently selected item is blue and super obvious.
(I am using the day theme, but the gear menu also looks better to me than the other Zulip dropdowns when I go into night theme.)

I also like this styling, although I definitely prefer the old-school style of the gear menu:

image.png
image.png

And then what not to do:

image.png
I'm not sure if this change is related to just the tippy migration, but I recall having issues with the dropdown standing out from the background, and this is much better :+1:

What's the thought on closeness to the stream/dm box itself? It maybe looks a bit detached?

I'm inclined towards wanting something to connect it to the box, though if it is like a triangle it might look too much like a large tooltip? (callout?)

This is a half-baked thought, but if Zulip wants a consistent style for indicating which item of a dropdown is selected, and the preference is for a somewhat subtle effect, then it might make sense to use the thin blue box from the message pane in other UI elements:

image.png

Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) said:

What's the thought on closeness to the stream/dm box itself? It maybe looks a bit detached?

I had the same feeling that it felt a little too detached.
I think the first thing I would try there is to just move it down a few pixels. It didn't feel super weird to me, but I had the same feeling as Neil.

I mostly appreciate how keyboard-friendly this UI is. If I open the compose box, my focus is appropriately in the widget to type out my message. I shift-tab twice and Zulip very appropriately puts me right into the dropdown with the focus on the filter box. (There would be no point in not immediately opening the dropdown since I have a constrained list of viable options.)

But then if I hit escape, there is a failure mode. My focus at that point should probably go back to the textbox where I compose the message?
My keystrokes are enter to reply, then shift-tab, shift-tab, then escape. And then I'm stuck.
In fact, try to replicate the above keystrokes and hit tab, and you will see an app that nobody tests with the keyboard.

I get this little bit of weirdness:

image.png
Can anybody replicate that? It seems like a global issue that tabbing from no-man's-land takes you to some strange HTML element that is kind of near the logo, but not quite.
Yeah, the tab/esc from the stream/dm box is a bit odd.

But then if I hit escape, there is a failure mode. My focus at that point should probably go back to the textbox where I compose the message?

Nice catch, I think it makes sense for the focus to stay on the stream box with the dropdown closed.
I will let Vlad Korobov comment on the focus colors.

Some related discussions:
#frontend > keyboard navigation in list widget
#frontend > dropdown list handlebars

Based on the discussion here and in PR, the remaining issues are:

  • #frontend > keyboard navigation in list widget (I will most likely address tomorrow)
  • Filter unfocused background color (waiting on Vlad)
  • Add more margin around the dropdown (waiting on Vlad)
  • Item focused background color (waiting on Vlad)
  • Should we not focus search box after ArrowDown on last item?
  • Should the dropdown be more close to the compose box when it is displayed above it?

Should we not focus search box after ArrowDown on last item?

I think if we do focus it, my expectation is that you can loop around in the other direction too, so pressing the up arrow while in the search box would take you to the last item.

I would like to be able to integrate the technical migration today if possible. A lot of these things can be follow-up tweaks. The things I want in order to do that are:

  • Let's remove the background for the "Filter" area when unfocused for now; we can iterate further but it seems like multiple folks have felt it's confusing as written and this would fix that.
  • For the dropdown's position, let's shift it down so that it overlaps the compose box, it feels weird for there to be a visual gap there.

(Many of these other tweaks are likely <10 line change follow-ups to a 700-line PR).
@Aman (amanagr) if you're still around, it'd be great if you can do those; otherwise I'll probably do them myself in my final review pass.
I am working on #25440 right now, it is almost done, will address this after that.

Updated!
Screenshot-2023-05-10-at-1.11.20-AM.png
Beautiful!
For followup, is it possible to make the list height an integer multiple of the shown height? The last entry looks weird? Unless that's intended to show there are more entries below?
Does that have a reduced gap?
Yeah, I agree, making the height such that you don't see a partial item would be a nice follow-up tweak.
@Aman (amanagr) There is one regression, but otherwise looks reasonable to me.

Tim Abbott notes that this change might be have been trying to avoid a situation where we just show the search box if there are no matches.

We can potentially show a "No matching streams" notice in that situation (similar to the screenshot below), but I think regardless the popover should be fitted to the content.

Screen-Shot-2023-05-09-at-1.22.53-PM.png

This is now merged, but we should definitely continue discussing tweaks to make this component nice! We're going to end up with a bunch of them with current product plans, since for example, all of our permissions settings being migrated to let you pick a group as detailed in #design > New permissions model, which we're likely going to be doing a lot of this summer, will eventually end up using this as the groups picker.

It is still growing down:
image.png
I suggest to lock a min-height
and it is still possible to have a single input field
image.png

The icon inside the dropdown field is small
image.png
See the discussion on the PR which has screenshots; the min height attempted there at least doesn't look great if there's only a couple options, which will be the case for any new organization.
(on my phone so can't easily transcribe)

The icon inside the dropdown field is small

It is the same size as in the left sidebar. See my reply to your feedback. This makes sense since in your design the font-size for the text is 16px while we use 14px in all our dropdowns. We can increase font-size for both icons and text but for that to not look odd we will have to increase font-size of the elements around it like message feed and compose box.

I suggest to lock a min-height

Alya suggested to add a No matching streams notice which will be our last visible item so that the search box is not out there alone.
I think it's still small in the closed state, and that's what Vlad was reporting.
Oh! yeah, will fix.

Screenshot-2023-05-10-at-4.56.54-PM.png

How about this "No search results"? We can use it for all the dropdowns, otherwise we will need to use a custom message for other dropdowns that are not streams.

Opened #25514, to address the following:

  • making the height such that you don't see a partial item
  • No matching streams notice
  • small icon size in the closed state
  • Keyboard navigation scrolling issue
  • Moving from search to last item on up arrow.
I am working on refactoring the dropdown widget further so that it can be used everywhere else with minimal code.

Tim Abbott said:

See the discussion on the PR which has screenshots; the min height attempted there at least doesn't look great if there's only a couple options, which will be the case for any new organization.

Well we could check the total number of streams and define this height upfront, right? Min height could be 3 rows, max height could be what is now and the height could be calculated based on total number of streams. Until there are more than 6?
I am happy to do this but feels a bit over-engineering.

Yeah, I agree with @Aman (amanagr) here that this might be a bit unnecessary. I completely understand the rationale behind the suggestion, but I think it's actually a feature, not a bug, that you can see partial list items.

I've merged #25514 and will get it deployed here soon, but overall it felt pretty nice playing with it.

I will note that the filter box behavior in this widget feels as a user very similar to the Typeahead we have across the app, and that collapses when there aren't many matches (and I think most other apps do too -- certainly it feels good to me that it shrinks when there's only one match to just show that one without a bunch of blank space), so I like the implementation we now have in main.
ok

When messages take a while to load at first, the stream dropdown opens automatically when you enter the compose box from recent conversations page. Is this a bug or implemented purposely.
Also If user has no subscribed streams, than this happens with only "Direct message" option.
Screenshot-2023-05-15-at-11.24.50-PM.png
I don't think this is intentional.
Since there is no message / topic / DM selected in this case, I think this is the correct behaviour.
Yeah, I think that's right. The behavior if likely the same if you've read all your messages and are looking at "Recent conversations" with the unread filter enabled.
Mm, I see.
